name: Tankardstown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed there over a quiet weekend late January 2013. Hard to find, but beautiful setting. Stayed in the main house, reception staff friendly and welcoming. Room very nice, bed extremely comfortable. Never had the breakfast, 1st day was our own fault (up too late). The second morning we had to leave early (8am) the receptionist told us the previous day ,that they would open the Brabazon at 7am. We got up early and walked around (pretty cold windy and raining) to restauraunt. It was closed. We walked back to main hotel, NO ONE there. receptionist finally arrived around 7.40. We told about closed restaurant , she said they would rustle up something for us. It was too late as we had a driver waiting to take us to airport. For about $375 a night B&B - we expect better than that.
reviews.title: It could have been so much better...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Judging by our experience and other reviews, they really need to work on the breakfast issue. I suspect they are more focused on weddings as opposed to weekenders.
reviews.title: A beautifully kept hotel of high standard with just a poor breakfast letting it down

reviews.text: There is a lot of choices out there - if the owners/mgmt of this establisment read these reviews, I might suggest a restaurant overhaul.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed recently in one of the Courtyard cottages on an admittedly foul weather weekend. The cottage was warm and cosy and very well appointed. Having your own living room/kitchen/diner plus double bedroom and bathroom upstairs is great value for the price of what normally only gets you a hotel room. The kitchen is fully equipped with a supply of coffee, tea, snacks and fresh milk in the fridge.
reviews.title: Great hotel for foodies
First time there
reviews.text: We were also shown a couple of the 6 rooms in the main house which are beautifully decorated with wonderful views over the estate and would be a good choice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were there twice in a short time and both time it was very good. First time we had a sunday meal at the coffee bar and it was excellent, service a bit slow. The second time we were at the restaurant for a sunday lunch/. The food was very good and so the service.I you look at negative point the wine list is too short and overpriced and the a la carte menu for a dinner is too particular ...not everybody will be adventuring in most of the dishes on the menu. But i will be back again for sure.
reviews.title: Twice very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We attended a wedding here last weekend and I have to say what a fine location. Beautiful grounds and fantastic building. The staff were excellent and the orangery is a fine location for a wedding. As it only hold one event per day we had the whole house to ourselves. I would love to go back for a weekend to experience the place again.
reviews.title: Excellent Wedding venue

reviews.text: I didn't stay in the hotel but ate in the restaurant and then went over to the bar for a drink. I've reviewed the restaurant separately. Firstly, the bar was messy when we walked in. It may have just cleared out but it didn't make a good first impression. There was no background music so we thought it was closed. A girl told us, no, they were open. We asked if they did cocktails and were told no. There was another man working in the bar. We were chatting to him while waiting for our drinks (they didn't have the prosecco we asked for in the bar even though its on the menu). 2 men walked in and the male staff member told them that they were closed so they turned and walked away. We expressed surprise at this and were told they weren't closed, but these people couldn't "just walk in off the street". When we pointed out that the men had been in the restaurant at the same time as us, the staff member went after them to invite them back in!
reviews.title: Bar service not great

reviews.text: Our drinks arrived and we got a call from our taxi to say he could pick us up early. We did just that.
reviews.title: Here for a wedding, fabulous!

reviews.text: Oh, and there was no toilet roll in the toilets.
reviews.title: Lack of service really lets beautiful property down

reviews.text: Just returned from an overnight midweek break. Stayed in a courtyard cottage with our baby. Thoroughly enjoyable experience. From the moment we checked in, we felt completely relaxed and at ease in the house. Receptionist greeted us warmly and gave us a tour of the luxurious 18th century house. The cottage was very comfortable - spacious downstairs living area which suited us perfectly with a young baby. Bedrooms were stylishly decorated.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended

reviews.text: Dined in the Brabazon which was a pleasure. Service and food was top class - couldn't be faulted. Would recommend trying the cured salmon for starters & the beef for mains. Breakfast the following morning was very good.
reviews.title: Country estate near Slane

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only issues to report were, as highlighted by other reviewers, the WIFI in the cottages does not work (tried unsuccessfully with 3 different devices) & there was a supplement charge for the beef which was not stated on the menu. However, this would not detract us from giving a 5 star rating.
reviews.title: wedding function

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here two nights in June 2013, for a friend's wedding reception. First of all, plug the coordinates into your GPS, otherwise it might be hard to find. On arrival, the first impression is very positive and the reception staff are welcoming. It is a truly beautiful venue for a wedding reception with large grounds and two enclosed gardens.
reviews.title: Hidden Gem near Slane, Co. Meath

reviews.text: Our room was, in fact, the living room of a 2 bedroom courtyard cottage suite, which we shared with two other sets of guests. However, our room was large and comfortable, and we had a separate bathroom on the ground floor.
reviews.title: Treated like royalty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from our first visit at the fabulous Tankardstown House. We have stayed in alot of hotels in Ireland & abroad and Tankardstown House is by far the best hotel we have ever stayed in! Absolutely stunning property & it is such a credit to the owner & staff. Everything is kept to an immaculate standard. On arrival we were warmly greeted and checked in, unfortunately the reception staff member was a little vague with some check in information which we didnt mind as she was being trained in. We booked one of the cottages & it exceeded our expections. The hot tub was just around the corner from our cottage in a lovely private & sheltered hedged area. We were supplied with robes & extra towels. Dinner in the restaurant was fabulous, service was very good but again one staff member currently being trained in lacked knowledge about the menu which is a pity, however this did not bother us. We enjoyed our dessert in the cellar bar by a roaring fire, infact every fireplace had a roaring fire. Breakfast was gorgeous with fresh fruit, freshly squeezed orange juice & a hot breakfast menu including smoked salmon & pancakes. Overall, this place is simply perfect & you will not be disappointed, infact you should probably book your returned visit too as this place is booked up very quickly. Enjoy!
reviews.title: Perfection

reviews.text: I've just returned from a bank holiday break with my boyfriend from the fabulous Tankardstown House. The drive up to the house along a tree-lined avenue is gorgeous. The house itself is beautiful, we were greeted by a friendly girl at reception who gave us a full tour of the house. We decided to stay in the main house, which is a little more expensive and stayed in the 'Roisin' Room, the bed was the biggest I've ever seen and tastefully furnished with cream and yellow soft furnishings and various antiques. The bathroom hosts an electric power shower and Molton Brown goodies. We helped ourselves to drinks in the self service bar and had our pick of tastefully decorated rooms to lounge in. Dinner at Brabazon restaurant was booked for 8, we were offered a complimentary glass of prosecco in the main house before hand then ambled along the pretty pathway hoping to bump into one of Tankardstown's canine friends! The service in the restaurant was excellent, as was the sommelier who poured our wine. The decor is French shabby chic and extremely tasteful. The food was delicious although I was disappointed as a poultry lover that there was no chicken or duck on offer. We retired to the gorgeous Cellar Bar for one afterwards where the friendly bar man kindly poured me a Grey Goose vodka( but only charged me for Smirnoff!) as he said the wedding they hosted the day before 'drank all around them! We strolled back to the hotel and took a peek at the gorgeous cottages dotted around a beautiful courtyard. Breakfast the next day was also served in the restaurant and my boyfriend assured me his poached eggs were 'the best he ever tasted' although my scrambled eggs were a little too seasoned with pepper. On our way back from breakfast we had a look at the magnificent Orangery where wedding meals are hosted, it's a truly beautiful room that would work well with numbers from 80-180 I would think, gorgeous patio areas for drinks outside and a pretty bar within the Orangery itself would make it a great choice if you are happy with the venue sleeping only 35 people and suggesting accommodation nearby. There is also a 'Secret Dining' area for meals for 50 or so people which would be nice for a second day. All in all a fabulous experience and I would highly recommend for anyone who wants to unwind in gorgeous surroundings
reviews.title: Mini Break for two

reviews.text: A family group of 10 went for afternoon tea, the surroundings are really nice, but I'm afraid that is the only good thing about it, The service was very slow, all of the items (sandwiches, scones and pastries) were placed on the table in one go. which left very little room on the table. tea and coffee arrived after the sandwiches had been eaten. coffee by the cup, we had to ask for a second cup of coffee and pot of tea, Processo had to be asked for as it was not forthcoming. Overall very disappointing.
reviews.title: Afternoon tea

reviews.text: Recently attended a fashion show at Tankardstown Main House. Have been to the Brabazon restaurant on a few occasions for special treats but had never been to the Main house. It really is an incredible spot - this house in the middle of County Meath came to life on a miserable Thursday night! Old part of house has been kept immaculate and charming to say the least. Entered into main hallway to roaring fires in all rooms and flowing champagne! What more could one ask for on such a dull night outside! Then we were piped downstairs to dinner in the Orangery - a new addition I believe - a glass feature done to a very high spec and yet very warm and cosy. We were treated to fabulous food and service and a great fashion show. We stayed in the bar till all hours and the staff kindly organised taxis home for us. Definitely a great night had by all and hope to be returning there very soon again.
reviews.title: Incredible Property
Didn't stay just called in for voucher
reviews.text: Called into Tankardstown today to purchase a gift voucher for Mother's Day, it's a trek to get there with badly potholed roads Meath co councils fault I know, how ever after phoning to ensure with Ronan that I could purchase a voucher in the main house I was shocked to be asked to go to the restaurant around the back, eventually a voucher was found while Ciara answered phone calls without acknowledging my presence. Place was a bit disorganised as a wedding on way. It disappointed me that they couldn't realise that my voucher was the easiest money the would make all day. In this climate I expected more.

description: A grand country house with 6 heritage bedrooms and adjacent bijoux Georgian courtyard of 6 magnificently restored cottages providing 1 and 2 bedroom cottages all with own sitting rooms and kitchen areas. Elegant interiors compliment a most discreet setting amidst the rolling country side of Co Meath. Historic sites of Newgrange and the Boyne River on 2 miles away. A true oasis of tranquility and beauty yet only 25mins from Dublin Airport and 45mins from the city centre.
